content: We've got 4 registrations now!
5 Registrations
6 Registrations (including me)
I'm really anxious to see how long it takes for someone to register that I don't recognize from Zulip or the issue queue.
We have 8 registrations
This week, I will be focused on publicizing the event and promoting registrations.
I've begun to solicit session topic ideas from people directly in private to help move things along.
We have 9 registrations so far and at least two presenters that have not yet registered.
Are there any registrations for anyone not presenting?
Yes
I'm counting
Three people are registered that are not yet hosts/facilitators (and may not be).
Newsletter will go out tomorrow (if I have to stay up all night). Hopefully, that is where we start to see some new folks register.

Somehow I missed this tweet from a week ago suggesting a session on:

"Easy to use photogallery solutions, for non tech website users"

https://twitter.com/mmmenouno/status/1298970807692132353

@backdropcms Easy to use photogallery solutions, for non tech website users

- Massimo Mezzini (@mmmenouno)
FYI: 10 official registrations so far. (We still have not sent the newsletter).
We just got our 15th registration.
18 Registrations.
Note. Making direct contact really works. Yesterday, I pinged someone on LinkedIn that has attended Backdrop CMS events in the past . Today they registered and donated $100.
I just asked if they knew about Backdrop LIVE and invited them to participate.

Still holding at 18 Registrations.
We have registrations from Greece, Zambia, Peru, Germany, UK, Canada, and the USA.
None from Australia?
Nope, @klonos is in Greece at the moment and BWPanda is not able to participate. They would be the two most likely people.
19 registrations!
20 Registrations with $500 in donations.
21 Registrations
22 Registrations - a user from Finland just registered.
26 Registrations (Another newsletter went out today. I hope to see a few more today).
28 Registrations
I found the second newsletter in my spam folder. I don't think the first one went there.
They both went to my SPAM folder. I suspect that this is a problem.
But then, newsletters going into SPAM folders is not a new problem.
Sure, but that might mean others are not seeing them.
Yes, I think that lots of people are not seeing them because of this. There are things we can do to reduce this problem, but not in the time we have right now.
I agree, but it certainly could be something to focus on in the near future.

We sent 2160 newsletters and this is the result after about 5 hours. I don't think that is too bad.

Banners_and_Alerts_and_Reports.png
31 Registrations so far (TOTAL)
33 Registrations so far (TOTAL) - $735
34 Registrations
39 Registrations
Amazing job @StPaulTim ++
stpaultim 1000% (Karma: 26)
...I just managed to contact the Greek Drupal community earlier today. There's 2 guys that are interested in a session in Greek ...sorry this is last minute :sweat:
41 Registrations
42 Registrations and our first from Australia.
43 Registrations for about $830
@StPaulTim I've just received an email from Eventbrite saying "Your event Backdrop CMS LIVE 2020 starts in 2 hours". I guess that's a time zone handling issue.
I hope nobody will get confused.

Speaking of confusion: the Eventbrite mail text isn't ideal as well

This event is hosted online
Access to this event requires you to be logged in to Eventbrite using the email you registered with. If you haven't set up an account yet, you can do so by clicking the button below.
I guess we can't change that, but we should be prepared that people might have issues to find Backdrop Live (right time, right place).

I've just received an email from Eventbrite saying "Your event Backdrop CMS LIVE 2020 starts in 2 hours". I guess that's a time zone handling issue.

Whoops, did not expect that. Will send something now with explanation
A correction is queued to be sent.
52 Tickets sold for just over $1000.
62 Registrations
65 Registrations
If your attending a session, please try to make a note of approximately how many people are attending.
Try Password= dragondrop
That worked. Thanks.
I thought the links were supposed to have the password embedded in them.
Some do and some don't.
We really didn't want them embedded, because anyone on the web can access the links with the embedded passwords. So, embedded passwords don't really protect us at all.

NOTES FOR LATER:

18 People were in ClassicPress and Backdrop Roundtable
14 People are in CiviCRM session right now
There were a max of 14 people in the Silkscreen session, but there were a lot of changes in which people were in at one time or another.
Thanks
15 people in Data Migrations
I think I saw it as high as 19 at one point.
Certainly at least 18.
16 people in the "Converting modules" session Andy's doing.
started with 12 people in "Automating and simplifying the set-up, maintenance, and hosting of Backdrop CMS sites", ended up with 15
23 people in the "The Future of Backdrop CMS (plenary)" session
6 people in the "New Features" discussion
4 People in Documentation discussion
9 People in the future events session
3 People in the Telemetrics session
Total Registrations = 67 (Raised $1300)
We have 5 Registrations - so far.
@StPaulTim Just noticed: on https://events.backdropcms.org there is an empty Newsletter sign up block at the bottom.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org/issues

backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org
Backdrop LIVE events. Contribute to backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.
Thanks for the link! I'm on a vacation and have no time to file an issue at the moment, so I hope in this case it's okay to just post it here.
It actually looks like it is that way on the main site, too.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/770

Newletter form missing 路 Issue #770 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Olaf pointed out that the newsletter form was missing in the footer on the events site, and then I noticed it was also missing on the main site. The block and title are there, but the form is not. ...
We have 9 registrations
We jumped to 14 registrations today.
How many registrations were there for the last LIVE event (for comparison)?
We got about 60 in total. But, we did a much better job of promoting it then.
Right now, I'd be pretty happy with 30-40.

@BWPanda - In the outreach meeting last week. We talked about sending a email to the Newsletter list (Mon or Tues) that is just focused on Backdrop LIVE.

Any thoughts. Should I go ahead and do that myself or would you like to do it?
You can do it. I'd have to be asking you what to put in there anyway.
22 People are registered so far.
I can attend Nate's core dev session hopefully.
@StPaulTim can you check to see if my registration went through? did not get email afterwards

Similarly, I registered about 6 hours ago, received the PayPal confirmation, but no email from Backdrop LIVE confirming registration. And when I go to events.backdropcms.org (logged in), I see no indication that I'm registered (i.e., I see a button to "Register for Backdrop LIVE").
25 People are registered so far. ;-)
27 People are registered so far.
31 Registrations so far. Personally, I had hopes for at least 30 and think that 40 would be a pretty good success. We're almost there.
I'll work on the pre-event email.
